welcome.data: Warm-up Prompt: "When you visit a site with tabular data—like schedules, price charts, or rankings—what do you notice first? The layout? The labels?" Students write and share.

aim.data: State agenda and objective: Understand how to use <table>, <tr>, <td>, <th>, colspan, and rowspan.

review.data: Review folder structure and linking concepts from the previous lesson on multi-page websites.

relevant.data: Mini-lecture and demo: Show how to use basic and advanced table tags in WebStorm. Demonstrate with live HTML coding.

interactive.data: Students build a class schedule table with at least 4 rows and 3 columns using colspan and rowspan.

ownership.data: Students personalize their table with real or fictional class schedule, add a caption, and push to GitHub.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: Ask students to reflect on what was tricky and where tables can be used in real sites.

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, GitHub accounts, projector, example table demo, internet connection.
